page.title: 18Fakenham Racecourse
page.content: Opened Easter Monday 1905. 35 horses ran in W.Norfolk Hunt Steeplechase. Small wooden stand, rails and proper fences added 1940s. Proper stand built 1953 _ capacity 1200. Stabling and watering facilities added 1965. 1 mile course known as tightest circuit in country. Run by board of directors _ most have ridden the course themselves Annual turnover nearly Â£1/4 million. Non-profit making _ all shares owned by W.Norfolk Hunt, spare money put back into course. Started with 1 meeting a year, went up to 2, now 6. Easter is the main meeting, about 5000 attend, but only about 1000 at midweek meetings. Once had a crowd of 8500 (nearly twice Fakenham's population). Small grant from Levy Board to help midweek meetings. Paddock and members' car park used as camping site in summer season. Sports Centre on land.
